name: Holiday Inn Civic Center (San Francisco)

reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights May 5-9/08.
reviews.title: Good Experience at Holiday Inn Civic Centre

reviews.text: The beds were very comfortable and the room was clean. We had bed quilts on our beds on the first few nights and then the housekeeping staff changed the bedding and didn't bother putting them back for the rest of the nights (therefore it made the beds look as if they were half done).
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Front Desk receptionist Benny was very helpful and approachable.
reviews.title: It all depends on the price

reviews.text: Breakfast off the menu was expensive and forgettable (yogurt and tea are $3.50 each!). A better option would be to head to the Health food store 2 blocks away to grab food and snacks.
reviews.title: the Ghetto!!!

reviews.text: The location was great as it was a few minutes walking distance from the Civic Centre Metro station . You don't want to walk around the area-especially Mission street.
reviews.title: Horrible. Worst Hotel EVER!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel has been undergoing rennovations for some time, and there is also building work at an adjacent property, where diggers etc made a huge amount of noise each day.
reviews.title: Ok hotel, rennovation noise, limited services

likes.disliked: — noise from windows and hotel rennovations as well as adjacent construction work

reviews.text: The bar and swimming pool are 2 facilities that have been out of service for a couple of months minimum, and room service options offer 4 options for $10, between 6pm and 10pm. So expect to have your needs met elsewhere. Prices were not low, so service cuts are in place, though rates are not.
reviews.title: The location this hotel was in was not one of the best...

reviews.text: Some of the staff are great, whilst requesting hours of work - eg. roof maintenance which created loud bangs all day, was greeted with incredulity by some of the staff: I was the hotel guest, and it was not my problem that they had subcontracted the work - take note Robert!
reviews.title: very frustrating experience

reviews.text: The hotel rooms have full length glass doors, which let in a ton of traffic noise too, as well as are poorly fitted, and whistles etc. from air leaks is common in most of them. Not the best experience if you need rest!
reviews.title: Not a good hotel

reviews.text: Beware, look elsewhere.
reviews.title: See the Ugly Side of SFO
Real decent hotel for the price- but in the middle of nowhere
reviews.text: I live in SF and stayed here in 2003 when we had a heat wave. Since residences don't typically have AC here in SF we sought refuge at this hotel, knowing it was cheap ($99) and had AC. Well, I was really suprised what a value this is. The area outside is a bit schetchy but it is very decent inside and the pool is actually pretty decent (most of the time in SF it would be too cold to use). The rooms have balconies too which was kind of fun.

The problem is you are in no mans land. You have a really long 5 big city block walk to the shopping areas and you have to walk through homeless central and all the strip joints. That's really a shame. But if you don't mind that it's a good deal. I would certainly not bring children, dainty women, or old people here. They would not be able to deal with that walk. You are only a block from Starbucks though so at least you can fortify yourself before beginning your morning hike through the homeless encampments.
reviews.title: Not upto the usual Holiday Inn standard

reviews.text: We have travelled across USA building up the priority points and decided when we reached San Francisco to stay in a Holiday Inn. Well not what we have come to expect. For a start the reception staff are at best rude, thats when they bother to even acknowledge you are waiting. The room was good but noisy, I accept that if you stay in a city center you expect noise but this was on the thirteenth floor and was still more noisy than even New York. The restaurant was very poor again bad service and food quality was not great, we even had off milk at breakfast which I would think is one of the basics. The area was not great, although you do have good access to public transport, you have to walk past all the beggers to get to them. Although this appears to be a problem with the whole of San Francisco. If we stay in San Fran again I would stay on the Harbour side of San Fran near the piers a much better bet even if a little more money, its worth it.
reviews.title: Great value for money hotel in the worst location
good hotel in a bad location
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago on our first visit to San Francisco. I remember pulling up outside the hotel and immediately locking the doors while my mum and I waited in the car. We decided to 'dress down' when we first went out so we didn't look like tourists. We headed to a nearby burger place as we were really hungry and I remember there being a security guard on the door and the man in front of us in the queue was paying for his burger from his days takings in a styrofoam cup. As we ate our meal a drugged up/mental guy was shouting at people at random.

Where do I begin? Housekeeping does the best with what they have to work with. Hotel is run down. I booked it on Hotwire thinking it was 3 stars. Probably more like a 2 star motel. Bath mat was filthy, shower curtains worn out. The shower water takes about 5 minutes to adjust from hot to cold. I lost money in the soda machines on the 8th and 9th floors. Instead of trying the 10th floor, I went to the front desk to speak to management. He smelled of alcohol and explained to me that they want to get rid of the Coca-Cola brand machines in favor of Pepsi but couldn't because of a contract, and that he was glad that I understood. He did walk me over to the bar to get me 2 bottled waters that I was trying to get from the vending machines. The pool is NOT maintained at all. Rust and mildew on the deck floor, kids throwing objects and/or garbage from their room windows into it. Dried up snot on the room walls by the beds. We left the room each morning with a not so fresh feeling. Good luck with the "stay online" hi-speed internet. Good thing we had our i-phone with us.
reviews.title: Don't stay here for more than 50.00 per night.

likes.liked: — Housekeeping ladies were extremely polite and did the best that they could with the rooms
likes.disliked: — Overall physical condition of the facility.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Holiday Inn, Civic Center, San Francisco.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Challenging Neighborhood

reviews.text: We arrived from SFO on BART, and walked one half block from the Civic Center station in the early afternoon.
reviews.title: A great deal for SF lodging with excellent service

likes.disliked: — Civic Center area is a bit gritty, but safe

reviews.text: The hotel is clean, with a large comfortable dual-lobby, and is replete with gift shop, cocktail lounge, and limited hour restaurant.
reviews.title: Good value for the price

reviews.text: We stayed here two nights - in town for a family wedding. So it was just a convenient location for us and I can't comment much on the neighborhood since I did not explore it. I do know there is a Starbucks within walking distance....and it wasn't too far from the hotel to downtown Union Square area (but not walkable in my opinion).
reviews.title: Not Bad at All

likes.liked: — Amenities, service, decor, closeness to downtown
likes.disliked: — Surrounding blocks seemed a bit run down

reviews.text: I liked the hotel and the room was very nice and the beds were quite comfortable. Nice view of the city. We had driven up from San Diego so we had our car but when my husband saw the in-hotel parking garage charged $27 a day he opted to park on the street for part of our stay and at the $9 per day lot across the street for one stretch of time... That worked out fine for us. (Also, if you have a handicapped sticker on your car, you don't have to feed the meter during the week or so we were told.)
reviews.title: good enough, value

reviews.text: I especially liked the Gym on the fourth floor, which had treadmills, stair steppers, recumbant and upright bikes, variety of weight machines and a TV, plus towels and water supplied. It was never crowded when I was there. I also enjoyed the heated pool (also on the fourth floor) which at mid day is in full sunlight so even though it was a bit chilly that day it was warm in the pool and lots of chaise lounges around and tables and chairs. I also liked the breakfast buffet. Mine was free because I am a Priority Club member.
reviews.title: Love the Holiday Inn civic Center.

likes.liked: — Everything/ room is big, clean and nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are two floors, 12 and 13 which the elevator will not stop at unless you have a keycard for that floor. So I guess if you are extremely security conscious you could ask for a room on one of those floors. My brother and his wife were on 12 but they did not ask for any special room, they were actually kind of annoyed that they had to insert the key to get up to their floor. The front desk neglected to tell them. But there is a sign in the elevator to that effect.
reviews.title: What a smell

likes.liked: — The gift shop person was very helpful in booking tours
likes.disliked: — The lack of attention from employees as you did not feel special

reviews.text: Nice bathroom, hair dryer, ironing board and iron in the closet. Enough hangers. A little low on surface/drawer space (three drawers in TV armoire and that was all). Lighting for applying makeup not very good, but they did have--in addition to the bathroom mirror--a pull out round mirror with a magnifying side that you could position different ways, plus the closet doors were floor to ceiling mirrors. (Well I was there for a wedding so these things were important to me!) Shower head had massage options.
reviews.title: One of the worst Hotels I have ever stayed in

likes.liked: — Price of the room is reasonable, but with trade offs
likes.disliked: — Old outdated property - not comforable at all

reviews.text: The hotel was selected as part of a trip planner service (Orbitz, Expedia, Priceline, etc.) and noted that the hotel lobby and restaurant were under remodeling/construction. I did not let this effect my choice since I wanted location to Market St and the 'F' Line street cars, BART and the city attractions.
reviews.title: Spring Break Vacation

reviews.text: What was not noted is that the 14th was also currently under remodel construction, not that this mattered for the most part since work only went on M-F during regular hours. However "we" received a notice of a water shut off from 10 am to 1 pm. Sadly I slept late and missed the shut off deadline, however figured I could get started just as easy mid-day. That was not the case as the water did not come back on until after 7 pm!
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.text: The only other annoyance was that the make shift gift shop and front desk never seemed to have or want to make change when trying to break down larger bills.
reviews.title: easy to get to from airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than the no water day and never being able to get change the staff was friendly and courteous. The room staff was friendly and always willing to tidy up (I stayed for a week so was not worried about daily service) and the hotel location was great - right in the center of town.
reviews.title: BAD AREA

likes.liked: — it was very close to the bay bridge

reviews.text: We stayed here for just one night. The best part of the hotel was it was across the street from the Orpheum Theatre where we went to see Wicked. This hotel is undergoing serious renovations. If you can get over the construction, it is very nice. It will be beautiful when they are done. We stayed on the 9th floor where the room was very clean and comfortable. My only complaint was the noise in the morning. If you want to sleep past 8am, stay somewhere else. I don't know if it was actually the hotel construction or the outside noise, but it was pretty loud. The hotel has a breakfast that was very good, however when they say it ends at 9:30 they mean it. Hotel is about a block or so from the BART which we took from San Francisco Airport (cheaper than taxi or shuttle and very easy to figure out, it took about 30 minutes). Yes there are homeless people around, but it is the city. We walked to and from the theatre at night with no problems. It's about a 20 minute bus ride/trolley ride to Fisherman's Wharf. The concierge told us which line to take and it stops every couple of blocks. The Westfield Mall is a couple of blocks away. All in all , a nice place to stay. We used a coupon from the Entertainment Book and saved 10%. When you book, sign up for their Preferred Customer status. We were able to check in early right after they told someone else they had to to wait til check in time.
reviews.title: Needs a refit

reviews.text: This hotel is just a short BART ride away from Union Square and all of the downtown SF shopping. The BART station is just 1/2 block from the front door of the hotel which is very convenient. It is also close enough to walk all the way to Union Square if you prefer but the walk doesn't take you through the nicest areas of SF. It's probably safe enough as long as you're going during reasonable hours but I'd just recommend taking BART.
reviews.title: An inexpensive way to see San Francisco

likes.liked: — The convenience to public transportation and downtown SF
likes.disliked: — Immediate area is a little sketchy, parking is $27

reviews.text: Like most Holiday Inn properties, it has an older feel but it is not rundown. The rooms are nice and clean and provide everything you'll need. Some of the rooms there don't have an outlet anywhere near the desk so if you're bringing a laptop, you might want to bring a portable power cord that can stretch across the room with you just incase.
reviews.title: Good value, if you don't mind the surroundings!
Ugly location
reviews.text: The front desk is extremely nice and helpful but my only complaint would be that they usually don't have enough people up front to meet the demand. It's not a place you can expect to walk up to without waiting in line.

Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. Just be mindful of the area you're in and don't decide to take a touristy walk after dark. Everything that is touristy is not walking distance from the hotel so use public transportation to your advantage.
reviews.title: Not the best experience

likes.liked: — I didn't have to stay for a second night
likes.disliked: — Incompetent staff, unsafe and derelict location.

reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location for getting around the city, it is right on the BART, and Union Square is walkable, as is the Powell trolley station. You can even walk to clubs in SoMa, although we found they were a bit spread out!
reviews.title: Good value, if you don't mind staying in at night

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent value hotel with clean rooms in a great location.
reviews.title: Excellent Value, Clean Rooms, Great Location
Even the hood is not that bad-and I was with my kids......
reviews.text: The hotel is located adjacent to the BART Civic Center Station. The hotel is walking distance to Union Square (15-20 mins).
Location is safe.
reviews.title: Hotel is good, neighborhood is not that scary.

reviews.text: Rooms are very clean.
reviews.title: Hotel okay, neighborhood not so great

reviews.text: Nice deli nearby.
reviews.title: Fair hotel, so-so location

likes.liked: — good prices when most major hotels in the city were sold out
likes.disliked: — breakfast insluded means just 20$ per room per day. Buffet costs 15.95$ per person!

aka: Holiday Inn Civic Center (San Francisco) Hotel San Francisco
description: The Holiday Inn Civic Center Hotel is a AAA 3 Diamond, full service hotel located in the San Francisco Performing Arts and Government District. Our hotel location is just steps from City Hall, Orpheum Theater, San Francisco s Opera and Ballet, Davies Symphony Hall and Asian Art Museum. Guests at the Holiday Inn Civic Center Hotel San Francisco will enjoy our complimentary Wireless Internet access throughout the hotel, free HBO, outdoor heated pool and sundeck, fitness center, and on site laundry facilities. Drinks and dining are available at the Jubilee Restaurant/Conversations Lounge. Major Credit Cards are required at check in. Indoor parking offered for $29 per day if driving in from either the San Francisco SFO or Oakland OAK airports or if traveling through the Bay Area and exploring the California Pacific Coast by car. Antique trolley cars provide convenient transportation to nearby Union Square, Chinatown, Moscone Convention Center, Fisherman s Wharf and Pier 39 attractions. Or catch the subway to the AT&T Ballpark, home to the San Francisco Giants baseball. With our 100% customer satisfaction, we look forward to welcoming you to the Holiday Inn Civic Center Hotel. We hope to be your home away from home each and every time you visit the San Francisco Bay Area.
